It is of no use to say, as many writers have said, that Christ was like all children. He was not like all children. Many children are misguided and mismanaged. But Joseph, who was supposed to be His father, and especially Mary, His mother, kept the realization ever before them of their Son's divine Fatherhood. Their child was instructed in accordance with the sacred character of His mission. His inclination to the right was a constant gratification to His parents."--Ms 37, 1898, pp. 2, 3. ("And the Grace of God Was Upon Him," typed March 11, 1898.) 

Released October 18, 1971.
